contest-event.event-date: Oct. 17, 1953 D National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Diadem of Gold Empress Hall, Earl's Court, County of London, England, UK Frank Wright was the appointed referee. Prizes: 1st: 200 Guineas 2nd: 150 Guineas 3rd: 75 Guineas 4th: 50 Guineas The youngest player, and only girl at the contest was 10 year old Mary Bailey with the Woodfalls Band. At 4.45pm the announcement of the results and the winning band playing a piece of its own choice was played on BBC Radio. 1953 was the second year in succession that the contest took place at the Empress Hall, Earl's Court. The contest started at 10.30am May 18, 2010, 1:22 p.m. May 16, 2020, 1:19 p.m. 1 Fodens Band Harry Mortimer 2 City of Manchester Jack Atherton 3 Creswell Colliery Band George Hespe 4 Rushden Windmill Band William Scholes 5 Ransome Band David Aspinall 6 Fairey Band Harry Mortimer 7 Govan Burgh Gregor Grant 8 Black Dyke Band Alex Mortimer 9 Parc and Dare Band William Scholes 10 Crookhall Colliery William Lowes 11 Wallsend Shipyard Walter B. Hargreaves 12 Woodfalls Band Sydney Clarke 13 Brighouse and Rastrick Band Eric Ball 14 Westoe Band Norman Piper 15 Morris Motors Band Harry Mortimer 15 Camborne Town Band Fred Roberts 17 Tullis Russell Mills Drake Rimmer 18 Hanwell Band Eric Bravington
